data.title: Kids In The House Announces Winners of The First Annual Parent Blogger Influencer Awards
data.meta_description: /PRNewswire/ -- Kids in the House, the popular new video-based parenting site, is celebrating the most influential parenting bloggers of 2013 in time for...
data.text:
SANTA MONICA, Calif., July 22, 2013 /PRNewswire/ -- Kids in the House, the popular new video-based parenting site, is celebrating the most influential parenting bloggers of 2013 in time for National Parents' Day, July 28, 2013, with the First Annual Parent Blogger Influencer Awards. Parenting bloggers are the heroes who have dedicated their time, voices and years of experience to share their best advice to make parenting a little bit easier.

(Logo: http://photos.prnewswire.com/prnh/20130529/LA22053LOGO)

The 17 bloggers, highlighted in this sizzle reel, exemplify the Kids in the House philosophy that there is no one-size-fits-all solution when it comes to parenting. Bloggers were invited to the Kids In The House Los Angeles-based studio to film a series of videos featuring their signature wisdom, humor and heart and were presented the award by CEO & Founder of Kids In The House, Leana Greene.

"The Kids In The House Blogger Influencer Awards gives us a unique opportunity to finally see the faces behind the written words of the bloggers who have influenced the parenting world in great ways for so long," says Leana Greene. "These are individuals who best exemplify the Kids In The House goal of education, empowerment and support for parents from all backgrounds and perspectives."

"As someone who never, ever does vlogging of any kind, I was thrilled and honored to partner with Kids in the House. My readers are loving the videos for a change and I love offering something new and different on the site!" says award recipient Jill Smokler, Founder of Scary Mommy and author of New York Times bestseller Confessions of a Scary Mommy and Motherhood Comes Naturally (and other vicious lies).

List of Winners of the 2013 Parent Blogger Influencer Awards:

Adrian Kulp –Dad Or Alive

Asha Dornfest –Parent Hacks

Bea Johnson –Zero Waste Home

Crystal Paine –Moneysaving Mom

Dan Pearce –Single Dad Laughing

Denene Millner –My Brown Baby

Dresden Shumaker –Creating Motherhood

Frederick J. Goodall –Mocha Dad

Heather Gibbs Flett –Rookie Moms

Heather Spohr –The Spohrs Are Multiplying

Jill Smokler –Scary Mommy

Katherine Stone –Postpartum Progress

Leah Segedie –MamaVation

Matthew Logelin –Matt Logelin

Suchada Eickemeyer –Mama Eve

Tsh Oxenreider –Simple Mom

Whitney Moss –Rookie Moms

About Kids in the House

Kids in the House is an educational website with the goal of helping parents and caregivers become better at parenting by educating, inspiring and entertaining. The 8,000 videos on the website feature interviews with over 450 top experts in parenting, including physicians, psychologists, researchers, educators and best-selling authors, as well as leaders of national organizations. The videos also feature parents who have dealt with particular issues and can share their hard-earned wisdom. Parents have the opportunity to hear and share different perspectives and get solutions for parenting challenges that range from pregnancy through getting into college. Kids in the House aims to be the most comprehensive resource for parenting advice, one which respects the fact that there is no one-size-fits-all solution.
